ai.summary: The Colne Valley Trail is a challenging long-distance hike in the UK, spanning 89.1 km and rated hard. It traverses varied landscapes and offers a demanding endurance route with scenic countryside views.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including country lanes, grassy fields, woodlands, riverbanks, and occasional rocky or muddy sections. Expect uneven footing, stiles, elevation changes, and exposure to wind in exposed sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for long stretches between resupply points; check local weather and daylight hours; carry a map and compass or GPS; tell someone your planned route and timings; ensure adequate water and food; wear sturdy footwear; be prepared for mud, flooded routes, and sudden weather changes; watch for livestock and agricultural machinery on open fields.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Hydration system or water bottles (2–3 litres)
Phone with offline maps and a power bank

seo.title: Colne Valley Trail - 89.1 km UK Long-Distance Hike (Hard)
seo.meta_description: Plan your Colne Valley Trail hike: an 89.1 km hard-distance route in the UK with varied terrain, safety tips, and essential gear.
seo.h1: Colne Valley Trail: 89.1 km Hard-Distance Hike in the UK
